body: Hi Sarith, There are solutions to figure this out both with Grasshopper or Honeybee methods. What is the context? Do you want to make sure that window is looking inwards? Are you using HBZone for daylight modeling or creating the model surface by surface? In the former window will always be looking outwards so you should reverse the order. In the second one you can use HBSurface.normal to calculate the angle between the surfaces to check.
